Liable.origin: [ultimately from Old French lier to bind, from Latin ligare ]

1.definition: answerable according to lawbound or obligated according to law or equity [one is as an accomplice to the crime of another "W. R. LaFave and A. W. Scott, Jr."] [the estate is for succession taxes ", 493 A.2d 297 (1985)"]

2 a.definition: being in a position to incur used with[ to a fire] [property to duties]

sub_terms.b: subject or amenable according to law
